entries.meaning: The act of reserving or keeping back; reservation; exception.
examples: I accept your view with one reserve.

entries.meaning: Restraint of freedom in words or actions; backwardness; caution in personal behavior.

definitionGroups.group: That which is reserved or kept back, as for future use.

entries.meaning: A natural resource known to exist but not currently exploited.
examples: New oil reserves are continuously being discovered, but not as fast as the existing ones are running out.

entries.meaning: A tract of land reserved, or set apart, for a particular purpose
examples: the Connecticut Reserve in Ohio was originally set apart for the school fund of Connecticut.
the Clergy Reserves in Canada are for the support of the clergy.

entries.meaning: (Canada) A tract of land set apart for the use of an Aboriginal group; Indian reserve (compare US reservation.)
(military) A body of troops kept in the rear of an army drawn up for battle, reserved to support the other lines as occasion may require; a force or body of troops kept for an exigency.
(finance, insurance) Funds kept on hand to meet planned or unplanned financial requirements.
A reserve price in an auction.
Wine held back and aged before being sold.
(ceramics) Absence of color or decoration; the state of being left plain.
examples: Each is decorated with a simple disk in reserve and a band in reserve adorned with white dots.

definitionGroups.group: (social) Something initially kept back for later use in a recreation.

entries.meaning: (sports) A member of a team who does not participate from the start of the game, but can be used to replace tired or injured team-mates.
(card games) A group or pile of cards dealt out at the beginning of a patience or solitaire game to be used during play.
In exhibitions, a distinction indicating that the recipient will get a prize in the event of another person being disqualified.
A preparation used on an object being electroplated to fix the limits of the deposit.

verbs.description: reserve (third-person singular simple present reserves, present participle reserving, simple past and past participle reserved)

examples: We reserve the right to make modifications.

entries.meaning: To keep in store for future or special use.
examples: This cake is reserved for the guests!

entries.meaning: To book in advance; to make a reservation.
examples: I reserved a table for us at the best restaurant in town.
Synonyms: sign up, register, schedule, enroll, book

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To make an exception of; to except.
